title: Hudson’s Bay Company: Canadian Identity, Commercialism, and Commemoration
description: In this episode, we examine the Hudson's Bay Company (HBC) and The Bay's history. The company's fur trade origins, interactions with its history, and its attempts at reconciliation with Canadian Indigenous communities are discussed throughout the episode. Professor Carolyn Podruchny, who is a fur trade historian and history professor at York University, was our special guest in this episode of The Hist List.
creator: Kaylah Christie, Jackson Li, & Maryam Noor
subject: Hudson's Bay Company

title: First Issue of The Beaver
description: This is the cover of the first issue of The Beaver magazine that was released in October 1920.
creator: Hudson's Bay Company
subject: The Beaver

title: “Last” Issue of The Beaver
description: This is the cover of the final issue of the magazine that used The Beaver name before being rebranded as Canada’s History. It was available from February 2010 to March 2010.
creator: Canada’s National History Society
subject: The Beaver

title: The Bay’s Flagship Store in Downtown Winnipeg
description: This is a photograph of The Bay’s flagship store located in Downtown Winnipeg. It was taken during September 2014.
creator: George Penner (photographer of the image)
subject: The Bay

title: Concept Art of the Southern Chiefs’ Organization’s Rendition of the Renovated Store
description: This is a piece of concept art that depicts the Southern Chiefs’ Organization vision for The Bay’s flagship store in Downtown Winnipeg after its renovations. The store will be used as a central hub for Winnipeg’s Indigenous community and it is set to open sometime in 2026.
creator: Southern Chiefs’ Organization
subject: Southern Chiefs’ Organization

title: HBC, Fort Garry, Red River Settlement
description: This is a watercolour over pencil art creation depicting a view of the Fort Garry, Red River settlement.
creator: James Lockhart
subject: Fort Garry

title: Hudson's Bay Post
description: A shop of the Hudson's Bay where trappers and Indians sell their furs partly in exchange.
creator: Felix H. Man
